lexUnit.name: dab.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: apply (a substance) with light quick strokes

sentence.text: She dabbed some perfume on her throat and ran downstairs .
As soon as he came in I made him let me look at his head , and I dabbed some Dettol on it .
Nevertheless , as I dab calamine on my spare tyres , I ca n't deny that this is n't my finest hour .
He winced as she dabbed disinfectant on the cut and covered it up for him .
She dabs a little powder on top , and stands back to admire the effect .
Dab royal icing onto the base of each petal and stick together .
I mix some sap green with Prussian blue and burnt umber still left in the palette and dab it onto the previously dampened , shaded areas of the greenery .
I picked a fish-louse from it as it lay on the unhooking mat , dabbed a bit of waterproof ointment on a small wound on its flank , then slipped it back into the water .
` If you must add more colour , dab it a little lower down , on a line with your ear lobes . "
She had dabbed powder over her lipstick to rob it of its bright crimson lustre , and she had forgotten the little pink patches of rouge that gave her cheeks their rosy healthy glow .
He put his head in his hands as the waiter brought over the glass of water ; he sipped it , and dabbed some on his temples to cool them .
Pulling out the oval gold Cartier compact she dabbed on a layer of powder and dashed the scarlet lipstick across her trembling mouth .
I dabbed a little on each puckered mouth to further shouts of laughter and much dancing about the room .
Never spray or dab on perfume before going in sunlight .
When Zoser dabbed a little on his wife 's sleeve she took the sleeve and held it up to her nose .
